record-type[Required] Type of DNS record type , valid values : A,PTR,CNAME,SRV,TXT,MX
dns-view[Optional ] The DNS view where record is located . By default, record will be searched in default DNS view.
a-name[Conditional] name of the host in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) format. ex - admin.demo.com (here admin is hostname and demo.com is authoritative forward-mapping zone ) . Required if DNS object of type A is specified as record-type.
ip-address[Conditional] The IPv4 address. Required to uniquely identify A record , if multiple object of type A with same a-name are present in infoblox. otherwise its optional
ptrd-name[Conditional] ptrdname is the domain name of the DNS PTR record. Required if DNS object of type PTR is specified as record-type.
ptr-name[Conditional] hostname to which PTR record to point. Required to uniquely identify A record ,if multiple object of type PTR with same ptr-name are present in infoblox. otherwise its optional
cname-name [Conditional] This is Alias for CNAME record , A name in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) format. The FQDN consists of the host_name followed by the domain name (example: abc.com). ex: 1.0.0.10.in-addr.arpa Required if DNS object of type CNAME is specified as record-type .
srv-name[Conditional] A name in FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name). ex - admin.demo.com (here admin is hostname and demo.com is authoritative forward-mapping zone ) . Required if DNS object of type SRV is specified as record-type .
srv-port[Conditional] The port of the SRV record ex: 10. Required to uniquely identify SRV record ,if multiple object of type SRV with same srv-name are present in infoblox. otherwise its optional.
srv-priority[Conditional] The priority of the SRV record ex:11 . Required to uniquely identify SRV record ,if multiple object of type SRV with same srv-name are present in infoblox. otherwise its optional.
srv-weight[Conditional] The weight of the SRV record ex:11. Required to uniquely identify SRV record ,if multiple object of type SRV with same srv-name are present in infoblox. otherwise its optional.
srv-target[Conditional] The canonical domain name of the host (not an alias); for example, admin.demo.com (where demo.com is forward-mapping zone ) , Required to uniquely identify SRV record ,if multiple object of type SRV with same srv-name are present in infoblox. otherwise its optional.
txt-name[Conditional] Host name / TXT record name in string format. Required if DNS object of type TXT is specified as record-type.
txt-string[Conditional] Enter the text that is associated with the TXT record. Required if multiple object of type TXT with same txt-name are present in infoblox. otherwise its optional.
mx-domain-name[Conditional] A domain name in Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) format. Required if DNS object of type MX is specified as record-type.
mx-preference[Conditional] The preference value of the DNS shared MX object. Required to uniquely identify MX record ,if multiple object of type MX with same mx-domain-name are present in infoblox. otherwise its optional.
mx-exchanger[Conditional] The name of the mail exchanger in Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) format. Required to uniquely identify MX record ,if multiple object of type MX with same mx-domain-name are present in infoblox. otherwise its optional.
scheduled-at[Optional] Specify the date time on which operation need to be executed. Date and time are represented in ISO 8601 extended format (e.g., 2008-10-21T10:56:00Z or 2008-10-21T10:56:00.001Z) with some restrictions. When the scheduling parameter is used, changes do not occur immediately. Instead at the date time specified in this parameter.
